title: Modin ray tests failing
body:
When running a Ray integration test using the Modin df engine, we get the following error:

```
E           Exception: Internal Error. Please visit https://github.com/modin-project/modin/issues to file an issue with the traceback and the command that caused this error. If you can't file a GitHub issue, please email bug_reports@modin.org.
E           Internal and external indices on axis 1 do not match.
```

This error is accompanied by the following stack trace:

```
tests/integration_tests/test_ray.py:218: in run_preprocessing
    check_preprocessed_df_equal(local_df, ray_df)
tests/integration_tests/test_ray.py:224: in check_preprocessed_df_equal
    vals2 = df2[column].values
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/logging/logger_decorator.py:128: in run_and_log
    return obj(*args, **kwargs)
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/pandas/base.py:3200: in __getitem__
    return self._getitem(key)
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/logging/logger_decorator.py:128: in run_and_log
    return obj(*args, **kwargs)
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/pandas/dataframe.py:2979: in _getitem
    return self._getitem_column(key)
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/logging/logger_decorator.py:128: in run_and_log
    return obj(*args, **kwargs)
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/pandas/dataframe.py:2399: in _getitem_column
    if key not in self.keys():
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/pandas/base.py:3437: in default_handler
    return self._default_to_pandas(item, *args, **kwargs)
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/logging/logger_decorator.py:128: in run_and_log
    return obj(*args, **kwargs)
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/pandas/base.py:420: in _default_to_pandas
    pandas_obj = self._to_pandas()
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/logging/logger_decorator.py:128: in run_and_log
    return obj(*args, **kwargs)
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/pandas/dataframe.py:2862: in _to_pandas
    return self._query_compiler.to_pandas()
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/logging/logger_decorator.py:128: in run_and_log
    return obj(*args, **kwargs)
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/core/storage_formats/pandas/query_compiler.py:282: in to_pandas
    return self._modin_frame.to_pandas()
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/logging/logger_decorator.py:128: in run_and_log
    return obj(*args, **kwargs)
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/core/dataframe/pandas/dataframe/dataframe.py:124: in run_f_on_minimally_updated_metadata
    result = f(self, *args, **kwargs)
venv38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/modin/core/dataframe/pandas/dataframe/dataframe.py:3057: in to_pandas
    ErrorMessage.catch_bugs_and_request_email(
```

Steps to reproduce this behavior:
1. Be on `master` after https://github.com/ludwig-ai/ludwig/pull/2637 is merged in, or check out that branch.
1. Remove the pytest skip mark for the "modin" test in `tests/integration_tests/test_ray.py::test_ray_tabular`
2. Run the test

It seems to be related with saving the DataFrame out to parquet (part of the caching behavior), loading it back to create a RayDataset, then converting that RayDataset to a pandas DataFrame. If the DataFrame is not written out to parquet, there is not a problem.

Versions:
Ray 2.0.0
Modin 0.16.1
